results.title: The Emerging eskimo
results.creator_credit: Brayton-Kendall Productions and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documentary film showing the effect of colonisation on the Eskimo socio-culture. Since the first arrival of the Europeans, the selling potential of Alaskan resources was quickly realised. This caused devastating damage to ecological aspects vital to Eskimo survival. In addition tho this, the film shows how colonial influence has caused ruptures in Eskimo tradition and religion.

results.title: The Eleven Powers
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Larry Gartenstein and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description: In 1979, the Festival of the Eleven Powers took place on the island of Bali. The festival is called into being every 100 years to mark the closing of the Balinese century and re-establish the balance of the positive and negative forces in the world. Over two million people took part in the sixty days of purification and religious fervour. Script by Bryce Courtenay and narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: The Elements of composition
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Defines and explains melody, harmony, rhythm and counterpoint to a young audience. Each element is illustrated by the New York Woodwind Quintet. The film emphasises that melody is full of character, the addition of harmony makes music complete, rhythm is of many kinds and can be felt and listening to counterpoint is like following a conversation. Summarises and contrasts the elements of composition through the playing of a harmonic, rhythmic and contrapuntal treatment of the melody. Script by Lydia Perera

results.title: The Electronic Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Electronic Office”.
A computer education program that consists of six parts, each 25 minutes long. The parts are: 1.”Office on the move”, 2.”The stand-alone micro”, 3. “Wiring up the organisation”, 4. “Changing with the times”, 5. “Wiring up the world”, 6.”Easy to use”.

results.title: The Electromagnetic spectrum
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Provides demonstrations of ultra-violet and infra-red radiation, radio waves and microwaves and shows the application of reflection of light in medical technology particularly X-ray machines, broadcasting and microwave ovens. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The edge of the possible
results.creator_credit: Daryl Dellora, Sue Maslin and Film Art Doco Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Joern Utzon, the Danish architect of the Sydney Opera House lives in Hellebaek, Denmark in a modest house he built himself. He is 80 years old and in his distinguished career he has recieved every major archticetural award. But in February 1966, it was a very differet story. In that month his nine years work on the Opera House came to an end. This beautifully photographed films charts the triumphant, exhilarating and then tragic course of the design and construction of the Sydney Opera House. For the first time in 25 years Joern Utzon appears in a lengthy interview speaking in English.

results.title: The Ecology of development
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Factors such as biological inheritance, temperament, caregiving, family, peers, schooling, culture and history are introduced. Four levels of the environment are defined and illustrated: microsystem, mesosystem, exosystem and macrosystem. We meet twelve families from five countries whose lives we share throughout the series.

results.title: The Eclipse = L'eclisse
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Raymond Hakim, Robert Hakim, Interopa Film - Cineriz and Paris Film Productions
results.brief_description: This, the third in Antonioni’s “cycle of sentiments”, begins with the break up of Vittoria (Monica Vitti) and her partner Riccardo. The film then follows Vittoria and Piero (Alain Delon) while a love affair is cautiously entered into. At times using plot and dialogue to spell out the themes, for the most part the confusion of the characters is suggested more carefully by the film’s surfaces, both in its use of composition and in the soundtrack. There are also intense concentrations on the surfaces and the figures that create character, but these are often diminished by reframing or set in tension with the solid forms of the architecture. ‘L’eclisse’ is preoccupied with immateriality and it is by way of edging away from any clear definition that it maintains a distinctly ‘modern’ air. Italian language with English subtitles.
